page.title: 01COLWYN BAY
page.content: Colwyn Bay is a seaside resort on the North Wales coast.It is very easy to enter the town via the new expressway opened this year.Penmaenhead has a vantage point which overlooks most of Colwyn Bay.You can see the Seventy Degrees hotel,the expressway,the break-water in Rhos-on-Sea and Pwllycrochan woods.The main feature in Colwyn Bay is the sea front.It has a pier and there are kiosks along the promenade.Eirias Park is another important feature.Here we find the Leisure Centre and other recreational facilities.Nearby is the Police Headquarters for the whole of North Wales.Adjacent to the Police Headquarters is the Civic Centre.St. Paul's Parish Church is situated in the town centre and directly beyond is Pwllycrochan woods.
